channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Eating yogurt regularly may reduce the risk of colon cancer, a study finds
item.description: Humans have been eating yogurt for millennia. Ancient texts reference its health-promoting properties. Now a new study finds yogurt may reduce the risk of certain types of colon cancer.
item.content:encoded:
Humans have been eating yogurt for millennia. Ancient texts reference its health-promoting properties. Now a new study finds yogurt may reduce the risk of certain types of colon cancer.

(Image credit: d3sign)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: New poll shows more support for immigration restrictions. And, this week in DOGE
item.description: Despite divisions over Trump's immigration crackdowns, Americans show growing support for immigration restrictions. And, several top federal prosecutors resign over pressure to drop Eric Adams' corruption case.
item.content:encoded:
Despite divisions over Trump's immigration crackdowns, Americans show growing support for immigration restrictions. And, several top federal prosecutors resign over pressure to drop Eric Adams' corruption case.

(Image credit: Carlos Moreno)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: An Israeli raid of a famous Palestinian bookstore stokes censorship fears
item.description: A famous Palestinian-owned bookstore in East Jerusalem was raided by Israeli police, stoking fears of increased censorship.
item.content:encoded:
A famous Palestinian-owned bookstore in East Jerusalem was raided by Israeli police, stoking fears of increased censorship.

(Image credit: Sally Hayden/SOPA Images)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: Which dog breed got robbed — AGAIN — at Westminster? Find out in the quiz!
item.description: This week, we've got little kids, loser dogs, the Super Bowl, '90s power ballads and too much government.
item.content:encoded: This week, we've got little kids, loser dogs, the Super Bowl, '90s power ballads and too much government.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: A federal worker tried to take Trump's 'Fork' resignation offer. Here's what happened
item.description: Liz Goggin, a social worker with the Veterans Health Administration, took the offer to resign in exchange for pay and benefits through September. Then she learned her position was exempt.
item.content:encoded:
Liz Goggin, a social worker with the Veterans Health Administration, took the offer to resign in exchange for pay and benefits through September. Then she learned her position was exempt.

(Image credit: Justine Kenin)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Parents, are you worried about burnout? Here are 3 red flags to watch out for
item.description: Parenting can keep you on your toes all day. But if you find it so physically and mentally draining you can't enjoy family time, it may be a sign of burnout. Here's what you can do about it.
item.content:encoded:
2024 advisory. That leaves parents with less time for themselves, their partners and leisure activities.'/>

Parenting can keep you on your toes all day. But if you find it so physically and mentally draining you can't enjoy family time, it may be a sign of burnout. Here's what you can do about it.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: This week in DOGE: Elon Musk's role in overhauling 'America, Inc.'
item.description: Elon Musk has emerged as a key figure in President Trump's plans to reshape the government. Here's a recap of this week with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) team he leads.
item.content:encoded:
Elon Musk has emerged as a key figure in President Trump's plans to reshape the government. Here's a recap of this week with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) team he leads.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Immigration poll shows growing support for restrictions, but deep divisions remain
item.description: A new NPR/Ipsos poll shows growing support for some restrictions on immigration. Still, many elements of President Trump's sweeping crackdown are unpopular with Democrats and independents.
item.content:encoded:
A new NPR/Ipsos poll shows growing support for some restrictions on immigration. Still, many elements of President Trump's sweeping crackdown are unpopular with Democrats and independents.

(Image credit: Carlos Moreno)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: YouTube turns 20 years old today
item.description: Twenty years ago, three former PayPal employees activated the domain name "YouTube.com." The first YouTube video followed soon after.
item.content:encoded:
Twenty years ago, three former PayPal employees activated the domain name "YouTube.com." The first YouTube video followed soon after.

(Image credit: Jeff J Mitchell)
item.dc:creator: Taylor Haney

item.title: Texas judge fines New York doctor for sending abortion pills to Texas
item.description: The ruling by a Texas judge against a New York doctor for prescribing abortion pills to a woman near Dallas could test "shield laws" in Democratic-controlled states where abortion is legal.
item.content:encoded:
The ruling by a Texas judge against a New York doctor for prescribing abortion pills to a woman near Dallas could test "shield laws" in Democratic-controlled states where abortion is legal.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
